title: No longer shall we remember flash times...
body:
Perhaps Riot can implement new in-game mechanics for champions, minions, structures, and wards to detect SS when used, their cool down times within range and vision. 

Example 1: Red team's champion x, flashes within sight of blue team's champion y, thus champion y can determine the availability of champion x's flash through toggling the scoreboard.
Example 2: Red team's champion x, flashes within sight of a trinket or control ward, giving blue team knowledge of its CD on scoreboard.

P.S. Please bug fix {{champion:82}} Q and E, as they have some rare hit or miss interactions with opposing team lane minions. 
If SS use is within you and your allies' (structures, minions) vision, the availability of that SS will be marked on the scoreboard? Approve?

replies.body: Like Chermorg mentioned, keeping track of enemy summoner spell timers is generally up to the player to track. I know it can be hard trying to remember when the enemy might have certain tools available, but I do think this is intended.

This is part of the skill involved in League of Legends. Riot implemented jungle timers because there was at the time no way to ping them and thus no way to reliably tell when they would be back up. Now that you can ping flash, if an enemy flashes itâ€™s your job to keep up with it.
